string-array.item:
How many Knights can you place on a chessboard without any of the Knights attacking one another?
The knight is a piece in the game of chess, representing a knight (armored cavalry). It is normally represented by a horse's head and neck. It moves to a square that is two squares away horizontally and one square vertically, or two squares vertically and one square horizontally. The complete move therefore looks like the letter L. Unlike all other standard chess pieces, the knight can "jump over" all other pieces (of either color) to its destination square. It captures an enemy piece by replacing it on its square.

There are 81 tennis balls out of which 1 is defective and weighs less than the other 80. You have a weighing scale that accurately tips over to the heavier side. Find the minimum number of times you would need to weigh to find the defective ball.

1 9 7 8
19 + 78 = 97
Find the next year that also shows the same property shown above?
What was the answer to question 2?

You own 25 Horses and you also own a race track on which a maximum of 5 horses can race. You need to find out which of your horses are the fastest but your timer broke. Racing 5 horses at a time and knowing only their positions after each race, find the minimum number of races you need to hold to find your TOP 3 Horses.

There are 100 monkeys numbered from 1 to 100 in a test lab. There are also 100 switches numbered from 1 to 100. Each of these monkeys are trained to toggle a switch that is a multiple of the number of the monkey. Assuming that all the switches are off in the beginning, find the number of switches that are on after all 100 monkeys are done toggling the switches.
What are the number of possible ways to traverse a 5*4 grid. A valid “path” is along the lines made by the columns and rows of the grid.
What was the answer to question 1?
